comment.text: This translation key is used to display an error message when a user attempts to submit an email address that is empty or invalid. It appears as an error message in dialog boxes and forms where users enter their email addresses, such as in the "Change Email" dialog. The translator should provide a generic error message for incorrect or missing email input.

usage.context:
<FieldContainer
 className="smtp-settings_input"
 isVertical
 place="top"
 hasError={errors[SENDER_EMAIL_ADDRESS]}
 errorMessage={t("Common:IncorrectEmail")}
 >
 <EmailInput
 name={SENDER_EMAIL_ADDRESS}
 isDisabled={isLoading}
 value={settings[SENDER_EMAIL_ADDRESS]}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Etibarsız elektron poçt' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Incorrect email'. 'Etibarsız' implies untrustworthy rather than simply incorrect.

While "Nesprávná emailová adresa" is understandable, a more accurate and natural Czech translation for "Incorrect email" would be "Neplatná emailová adresa" or simply "Neplatná email".  "Nesprávná" implies a mistake, whereas "Neplatná" directly means invalid.

While 'Ungültige E-Mail-Adresse' is a technically correct translation, 'Incorrect email' often implies a typo or formatting error. 'Falsche E-Mail-Adresse' might be a more accurate and natural translation in many contexts.

While technically correct, "Սխալ էլ․ հասցե" is a literal translation and sounds slightly unnatural in Armenian. A more natural phrasing would be "Միջնորդական գծում սխալ էլ․ հասցե եղավ" or simply "Սխալ էլեկտրոնային փոստ" (Incorrect email address).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "Սխալ էլեկտրոնային փոստ" or "Միջնորդական գծում սխալ էլ․ հասցե եղավ".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'メールが正しくない' while technically correct, is a bit stiff and formal for a simple "Incorrect email" message. It translates more closely to 'The email is not correct'. A more natural and commonly used translation would be 'メールアドレスが違います' (meeru adoresu ga chigaimasu) or 'メールアドレスの間違いです' (meeru adoresu no machigai desu).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: メールアドレスが違います (meeru adoresu ga chigaimasu) or メールアドレスの間違いです (meeru adoresu no machigai desu)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation "유효하지 않은 이메일입니다" while technically correct, is a bit formal and verbose for a simple 'Incorrect email' label. It translates to 'It is an invalid email.' A more natural and concise translation would better suit the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more concise translation like "잘못된 이메일입니다" (Jalmae-doen imeil-imnida) which translates to 'Incorrect email' more directly.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Nepareiza e-pasta adrese" is understandable, a more precise translation of "Incorrect email" would be "Nepareizs e-pasts". "Adrese" refers to the address itself, while "pasts" refers to the email itself.

The translation 'Adresa de e-mail nu este valabilă' is a more verbose translation of 'Incorrect email'. While grammatically correct, it loses the brevity of the original. A more direct and commonly used translation would be 'Email incorect'.

The translation "වැරදි වි-තැපෑලකි" (weradi vi-tapaekiki) is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Incorrect email." While technically conveys the meaning, a more common and natural rendering would be "මිසමතැපැල් ලිපිනය" (misamatapeel lipinaya) or "කිඩාවුන තැපැල් ලිපිනය" (kidaawuna tapeel lipinaya). "වි-තැපෑලකි" sounds awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: මිසමතැපැල් ලිපිනය (misamatapeel lipinaya) or කිඩාවුන තැපැල් ලිපිනය (kidaawuna tapeel lipinaya)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Нетачан емаил" is not the most natural-sounding translation of "Incorrect email" in Serbian. "Неисправан емаил" or "Невалидан емаил" would be more common and idiomatic.
